alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Eastern Hillsborough; Merrimack; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 14 at 6:37AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Hampshire, including the following areas, in New Hampshire, Western And Central Hillsborough. In central New Hampshire, Merrimack and Sullivan. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire and Eastern Hillsborough. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Convective showers will continue through early this morning before a brief lull arrives by late morning. Another round of showers and thunderstorms are then expected to develop this afternoon and persist through early this evening. The potential exists for showers and thunderstorms to produce 1 to 2 inches of rain with localized amounts of 3 to 4 inches possible. Rivers and streams are already running high and any additional rainfall will likely go straight to run-off across areas that have recently received heavy rainfall and flooding.
info.instruction: You should monitor the latest forecast and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
